task.title: Removing and Installing Transmission Bands
task.shortdesc: Complete procedure for removing and reinstalling transmission bands, including proper positioning and alignment of components.

prereq.p: Ensure vehicle is stationary and in a safe working position.

context.p: This procedure covers both the removal and reinstallation of transmission bands. Proper positioning of components is critical for successful completion.

step.cmd: Remove the door on top of transmission cover

substep.cmd: Turn the reverse adjustment nut to the extreme end of its shaft
Turn the brake adjustment nut to the extreme end of its shaft
Remove the slow speed adjusting screw
Remove bolts securing the transmission cover to crank case

step.info: Place one set approximately 10 degrees to the right of center at top

substep.cmd: Slip the band over the first of the triple gears
Rotate the band so the opening faces downward
Lift the band upward to remove

step.info: Begin with the band nearest the flywheel

substep.cmd: Place bands in upright position on the drums
Pass a cord around the ears of all three bands
Center the bands using the cord
Ensure clutch release ring is in rear groove of clutch shift
Place cover while maintaining band position with cord
Verify pedal shafts align with band ear notches

result.p: When properly completed, all bands should be correctly positioned with the transmission cover securely installed.
result.note: Each band must be pushed forward onto the triple gears during removal, as this is the only point with sufficient clearance in the crank case to turn the band ears downward.
